definition: fourth of the ten Heavenly Stems 十天干[shi2 tian1 gan1]/fourth in order/letter "D" or Roman "IV" in list "A, B, C", or "I, II, III" etc/ancient Chinese compass point: 195°/butyl/cubes (of food)

sentences.english: His baits were the sardines the boy had given him.
sentences.chinese: 他的魚餌是孩子們給的沙丁魚。

sentences.english: All crabs are fed with fresh sardine fish.
sentences.chinese: 所有軟殼蟹均用新鮮沙丁魚餵食。

sentences.english: We all crowd together on the train for Beijing, like pilchard.
sentences.chinese: 在去北京的火車上我們大家擠在一起，像沙丁魚似的。

sentences.english: I'll get the cast and go for sardines. Will you sit in the sun in the doorway?
sentences.chinese: 我拿魚網撈沙丁魚去。你坐在門口曬曬太陽可好？
我去弄點沙丁魚來好嗎？

sentences.english: All of us were packed like sardines in the train to Beijing.
sentences.chinese: 在去北京的火車上我們大家擠在一起，像沙丁魚似的。

sentences.english: The commuters were packed into metro like sardines in a can.
sentences.chinese: 上下班的人把地鐵擠得像沙丁魚罐頭一樣。

sentences.english: We were packed like sardines in the train.
sentences.chinese: 我們在火車裏被擠得像沙丁魚似的。

sentences.english: Now I must get your sardines and mine and your fresh baits.
sentences.chinese: 現在我該去拿你我用的沙丁魚，還有給你的新鮮魚餌。

sentences.english: This could be bigger than Sardine Land.
sentences.chinese: 這個會比沙丁魚大陸更大的。

sentences.english: I feel like sardine in a tin can.
sentences.chinese: 我感覺自己就像裝在鉄罐子裏面的沙丁魚。

sentences.english: We were packed like sardines in the rush-hour train.
sentences.chinese: 在高峯時刻的火車上我們被擠得像沙丁魚。

sentences.english: Eat up: low-mercury "yes" fish such as sardines, wild salmon and farmed striped bass.
sentences.chinese: 可以喫低汞魚類，比如沙丁魚，野生鮭魚和養殖鱸魚。

definition: fish maw/a food dish made from the swim bladder of fish
rice in gravy, typically with meat and vegetables
katsuobushi or dried bonito flakes (paper-thin shavings of preserved skipjack tuna)
grouper (Portuguese: garoupa)/also called 鮨/Epinephelinae (subfamily of Serranidae, fish family including grouper)
